revised_title: Spectroscopic Observations of Sunspots and Their Implications
tldr: The author conducts spectroscopic observations of sunspots to test theories about their formation and physical properties. The observations show that sunspot spectra have thicker absorption bands compared to the surrounding photosphere, suggesting that the phenomena of sunspots are not due to radiation from a source like the one proposed by M. Faye. This supports the absorption hypothesis and provides a possible solution to the problem of sunspot formation.
